text: It has previously been shown that in these transgenic mice , <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression was restricted to B220+ B cells with lymphoma detected in greatly enlarged spleens [ 23 , 26 ] .

text: To investigate whether <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression contributes to lymphoma development , B cells were purified from splenocytes by positive selection using anti - <extra_id_0> CD19 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> MACS magnetic beads , and equivalent amounts of B cells were analyzed by immunoblotting .

<extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was detectable in <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transgenic B cells , but upon development of lymphoma , <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression was stronger in 5 / 7 lymphomas analyzed with concomitant appearance of degradation products ( Figure 1A ) .

text: To determine whether the higher level of <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> detected was due to an expansion of malignant lymphocytes , expression of <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in the spleen was further evaluated by immunohistochemical staining .

text: Immunohistochemistry analysis of spleen sections detected <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in the plasma membrane of cells in both the follicular white pulp and circulating lymphocytes in the red pulp ( Figure 1B ) .

<extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression was heterogeneous with strong <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> staining interspersed amongst a background of cells staining weakly for <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

text: Upon development to lymphoma , <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression was more abundantly detected with multiple foci of intense <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> staining .
